description.narrative: Plan Finland?s Gender, Inclusion and Advocacy budget will be used to achieve cross-cutting objectives. The aim is to implement Plan?s Human Rights Based Approach, i.e. Child Centered Community Development. Plan?s programming focuses on reaching the most v ulnerable children, children with disabilities and from ethnic minorities. In many case girls. Plan has set very ambitious goals for Gender Mainstreaming: all programs must address at a minimum girls' practical needs, in addition to other objectives. Reach ing the children and supporting them to fully realize their rights is challenging due to many reasons such as low capacity of staff and implementing partners, lack of practical tools and data, attitudes etc. Gender, Inclusion and Advocacy budget will be us ed annually based on identified strategic initiatives that can leverage the most results / widest impact or to programme countries, where the context for tackling exclusion and gender inequality is the most challenging. Directly the initiatives will improv e the everyday status of the most vulnerable children, girls and women. Partnerships will be made on case-by-case basis, choosing partners who are either strategically positioned or have special expertize.
